an5.111:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities who visits families is unlikable and unlovable, not respected or admired.
an5.111:1.3: They act as though they're close to people they hardly know. They give away things they don’t own. They over-associate with close friends. They whisper in the ear. And they ask for too much.
an5.111:1.4: A mendicant with these five qualities who visits families is unlikable and unlovable, not respected or admired.
an5.111:2.1: A mendicant with five qualities who visits families is dear and beloved, respected and admired.
an5.111:2.3: They don’t act as though they're close to people they hardly know. They don’t give away things they don’t own. They don’t over-associate with close friends. They don’t whisper in the ear. And they don’t ask for too much.
an5.111:2.4: A mendicant with these five qualities who visits families is dear and beloved, respected and admired.”
